\subsection{Detailed Description}
A label class that has letters as content instead of pictures such as \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GPictureSymbol}{GPictureSymbol} 

\subsection{Constructor \& Destructor Documentation}
\hypertarget{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GSymbol_a597ee43c991d767196400779091826c3}{
\index{OpenViBEApplications::GSymbol@{OpenViBEApplications::GSymbol}!GSymbol@{GSymbol}}
\index{GSymbol@{GSymbol}!OpenViBEApplications::GSymbol@{OpenViBEApplications::GSymbol}}
\subsubsection[{GSymbol}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}GSymbol::GSymbol (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{const char $\ast$}]{symbol, }
\item[{boost::shared\_\-ptr$<$ FTFont $>$}]{font, }
\item[{OpenViBE::float32}]{fontScaleSize}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}}
\label{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GSymbol_a597ee43c991d767196400779091826c3}
TODO: certain copies of objects should use the same font source to save memory and time for deleting and creation of font object. The management of this is done in \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1P300KeyboardHandler_a60751010ae5c5533655c10102290d934}{P300KeyboardHandler::constructGLabelFromDescriptor}, but it does not belong there, a manager such as the OpenGL managers should be made for fonts as well in \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1P300KeyboardHandler_a60751010ae5c5533655c10102290d934}{P300KeyboardHandler::constructGLabelFromDescriptor} we check whether a certain key already exists that uses the same font resource, in which case no new font object is created 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em symbol} & the string (word or character) that should be displayed \\
\hline
{\em font} & a shared pointer to a font object of the FTGL library \\
\hline
{\em fontScaleSize} & a number between 0 and 1 to define its size (1 almost filling up the entire label box) \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\hypertarget{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GSymbol_a9939ec117a7f3dbfe63507d8b1f08696}{

\label{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GSymbol_a9939ec117a7f3dbfe63507d8b1f08696}

\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em symbol} & the string (word or character) that should be displayed \\
\hline
{\em fontPath} & the path to the ttf file which defines the font and from which a FTFont object will be created \\
\hline
{\em fontScaleSize} & a number between 0 and 1 to define its size (1 almost filling up the entire label box) \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}

\hypertarget{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GSymbol_a53747ffe50a464dd798328075d8760b0}{

\begin{DoxyParamCaption}

\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily  \mbox{[}protected, virtual\mbox{]}}}}
\label{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GSymbol_a53747ffe50a464dd798328075d8760b0}
Overwrites the default maximum size as computed by the super class \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GLabel}{GLabel}. This is because we need some specific properties from the bounding box of the symbol in a certain font to compute the point size of that font. 

Reimplemented from \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GLabel_a7f0688b34724d97ba7f01383b5b63363}{OpenViBEApplications::GLabel}.

\hypertarget{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GSymbol_a7b03ff2c19eb8ef34decd0b5ce8f6211}{
\index{OpenViBEApplications::GSymbol@{OpenViBEApplications::GSymbol}!setDimParameters@{setDimParameters}}
\index{setDimParameters@{setDimParameters}!OpenViBEApplications::GSymbol@{OpenViBEApplications::GSymbol}}
\subsubsection[{setDimParameters}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}void GSymbol::setDimParameters (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{{\bf BoxDimensions}}]{dim}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily  \mbox{[}virtual\mbox{]}}}}
\label{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GSymbol_a7b03ff2c19eb8ef34decd0b5ce8f6211}
This will call the setDimParameters from the super class \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GLabel}{GLabel} which will recompute the maximum label size (by calling the computeMaximumLabelSize of this class \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GSymbol}{GSymbol}) and will call the generateGLDisplayLists of this class \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GSymbol}{GSymbol} (which also calls the generateGLDisplayLists of \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GLabel}{GLabel}). This is because these functions are all virtual and first the derived class function is called before the base class function 

Reimplemented from \hyperlink{classOpenViBEApplications_1_1GLabel_ad720a3ee7c141b7eaa25be2adf7a2256}{OpenViBEApplications::GLabel}.
